TopicTitle: [AnyOS] KSP Mod Admin v2 - Mod install with a few clicks

Articles.Content:
I found an odd issue in my case that, apparently, only affects Kronal Vessel Viewer.

It doesn't copy the full archive over. Here is how it looks in KSP Mod Admin 1.4.0 PR15:

But inside GameData, for the manually extracted mod, the folder structure includes these folders:

This was fixed, but the latest binary is still in private testing.

Edited November 13, 2014 by 4o66
Removed links to testing binary.

How do you update mods with this? Like for example retrofuture recently updated, so it goes blue, but I can't seem to find a way to have it download the new stuff.

If you mean the version 2 pre-releases: (Update check is only supported for Curse for now.)

Right-click the mod and select update.

(Yes, I do have too many mods installed. This is why I am so interested in the program.)

If you want to see if your mods have updates, there are buttons for mass check and update too.

Edited November 13, 2014 by 4o66
Clarified

I found an odd issue in my case that, apparently, only affects Kronal Vessel Viewer.

It doesn't copy the full archive over. Here is how it looks in KSP Mod Admin 1.4.0 PR15:

[pic]

But inside GameData, for the manually extracted mod, the folder structure includes these folders:

[pic]

Hi LitaAlto,

Yes this is a know issue with KSP MA 1.4.0 PR15. It is fixed in the new version which is not public yet due to testing reasons.

This was fixed, but I don't think the binary was released.

I have merged in all the recent changes up to present and released a binary via github.

[...]

If you mean the version 2 pre-releases: (Update check is only supported for Curse for now.)

Right-click the mod and select update.

[pic]

(Yes, I do have too many mods installed. This is why I am so interested in the program.)

If you want to see if your mods have updates, there are buttons for mass check and update too.

[pics]

Hi 4o66,

to avoid any confusion please don't post any download links of KSP MA aOS! The version is not public yet!

Till a release of KSP MA aOS, i can be sure that all questions, are related to the last released version (1.4.0 PR 15).

Hey , I just found this nice little tool !

I'll use it mainly to get rid of the part I NEVER use ( AKA stock wings ).

I read the thread quickly to see if there was some compatibility issues and then I saw that post

@All:

Almost 1k views since my last post and only 3 volunteers...

Anyway, I still need help with the translation to other languages then Italian or Portuguese.

It would be great to find some people for the skandinavian languages or french, russian, spanish, polish, greek, dutch, hungarian or any other language (this is not a ranking and quiet far from complete).

I don't know if I could handle chinese or japanese but hey lets try =)

from MacTee .... it broke my hearth , cause he's kind of right !

So anyways, I'm a french canadian and I could easily do the french translation. The thing is, I don't have any clue of how to do this ! Can you PM me like some kind of config file with all the text of the GUI line based and then I can translate it easily ? I don't know much about programming so just let me how how I can help !
PM MacTee to ask for the beta build. In comes with all the files you need for translation. (It's pretty self explanatory, but if you have questions, just ask.)

This tool looks really useful to me, but I'm having a pretty serious issue that is stopping me from really using the program. When I use the browser to try to download mods it just says "Mod download started... Done!" but the mod does not show up in the mod list, nor do I see a mod downloaded in my download folder. I've read back through about 10 pages of this thread but I didn't see anyone having this issue so I have to assume I'm just doing something wrong. Any help would be appreciated in solving this as this tool looks amazing and is just what I was hoping to find after having taken a long break from the ksp scene.

This tool looks really useful to me, but I'm having a pretty serious issue that is stopping me from really using the program. When I use the browser to try to download mods it just says "Mod download started... Done!" but the mod does not show up in the mod list, nor do I see a mod downloaded in my download folder. I've read back through about 10 pages of this thread but I didn't see anyone having this issue so I have to assume I'm just doing something wrong. Any help would be appreciated in solving this as this tool looks amazing and is just what I was hoping to find after having taken a long break from the ksp scene.

I had this same issue, with one difference. Mine was working just fine then I uninstalled KSP and removed all mods. Can't get the download/install button to work at all now. I don't even get the download message in the debug window.

Hi Borisbee & jsowder32,

sry, that you encounter problems with KSP MA!

Could you both send me the kspma.log file from the KSP Mod Admin install folder please?

Hi Borisbee & jsowder32,

sry, that you encounter problems with KSP MA!

Could you both send me the kspma.log file from the KSP Mod Admin install folder please?

The file was too long to post, so I emailed it to you.

I manually reloaded a bunch of mods and put in the site links too. But each time, I tried to use both the download and download/install buttons while in the browser before manually installing. Neither worked, even though the download button said it did in the log.

Love the app. First one I've tried that worked really well. Hope you can find where I went wrong so I can get the functions back again.

Hi Guys, i am experiencing a similar problem.

Until 17. of November i was able to update all my mods, but wenn i checked next at 21. it didn't work for mods from curseforge any more. It also indicates now, that all my mods from there have no more valid URL, but when i click on them and access them in the browser of MA, it is no problem. But when i try to download them, i have the same issue as Borisbee. Perhaps something in Curseforge has changed?

Kerbal Forum mods are still working fine. I checked the changelog, but didn't find anything strange....

And i am sorry if my english is a bit strange, but it's not my normal language, and it is late here

It looks like Curse has changed how they report mods. I am looking into it and have isolated the issue. Since Curse has crap for an API, this is something that will break every time they change their site.

Edit:

Confirmed, the Curse site changed their HTML, so that the values that are needed are not where the programs expects to find them.

<programmer-rant>

Since Curse doesn't have an API worth using (only lets you upload, not query? ...), you have to go digging to get the data you want. On top of that, they don't even bother putting the common data like project name, creation/modification date, etc inside unique DIVs, so you have to use XPATH to find it.

</programmer-rant>
